discussion.content: A,B,C looks to be the answer based on "Specify each range in a FILTER clause in a TABLE or MAP statement." from the GG documentation.
B and E are eliminated by the wrong column name, so A C D would be correct
And A,B,C are all complete ones. As the question is looking for Extract and Replicat process commands, and not only the @RANGE syntax.

Then how B will be correct?
nowhere in the question, anything is said about a column "ID".
So if B is correct means SYNTAX correctness is considered, so by this C holds correct.
Seems C is wrong, because of tablename and column ID. Should be D instead

questions.question_text: Which three are valid Extract or Replicat statements using the @RANGE function for an Acct table with a Primary Key on the AccountID column? (Select three.)

choices.B: MAP sales.acct, TARGET sales.acct, FILTER (@RANGE (1, 3, ID));
choices.A: MAP sales.acct, TARGET sales.acct, FILTER (@RANGE (2, 3, AccountID));

questions.question_text: Which parameter for GoldenGate 12c enables DDL replication for a Replicat?

discussion.content:
https://docs.oracle.com/goldengate/c1230/gg-winux/GWURF/ddl.htm#GWURF443

When used without options, the DDL parameter performs no filtering, and it causes all DDL operations to be propagated as follows:

As an Extract parameter, it captures all supported DDL operations that are generated on all supported database objects and sends them to the trail.

As a Replicat parameter, it replicates all DDL operations from the Oracle GoldenGate trail and applies them to the target. This is the same as the default behavior without this parameter.

choices.C: DDL for Replicat is enabled by default.

questions.question_text: Your Replicat performance seems slow. Which Replicat parameter can be used to improve performance?

discussion.content: D looks to be the answer

questions.question_text: Which Logdump command is used to check how many change records are in the trail file?
Veridata has completed the initial comparison and you want to view the rows that appear to be out-of-sync. How can you do this?
